change.changenote: Section 3 (1) and (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 297/2010, effective October 8, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person who is, or is applying to become an operator or proprietor must pay the fee set out in the Schedule if

paragraph.paragraphtext: an application is being made for an operating permit, or
an operating permit is renewed and the operator or proprietor had an operating permit in force anytime during the 12 months prior to the renewal in respect of the same swimming pool or restaurant.

subsection.subsectiontext: Approval is given for the remission of a fee paid under this section if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the operator or proprietor applies for the remission, and
the fee is for a month of the fiscal year for which the operator or proprietor was not required to have the operating permit to which the fee applies.

change.changenote: Section 4 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 297/2010, effective October 8, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to section 7, if an operator or proprietor pays the applicable fee set out in the Schedule, the operator or proprietor must be issued a decal to cover the period for which the fee is paid.

change.changenote: Section 6 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 297/2010, effective October 8, 2010.

section.sectiontext: Notwithstanding sections 3 and 4, if a swimming pool or restaurant is in operation for no more than 14 days during a fiscal year, then

paragraph.paragraphtext: approval is given for a reduction in the applicable fee so that the operator or proprietor or other person is not required to pay the fee set out in the Schedule, and
the operating permit is not required to bear a decal to be valid.
